Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

No problem,

Actually nothing is interrupting the Maximal plot for the moment. I have no
immediate plans for any mass full scale invasion. This will not be like the
last minion incursion on Earth. If you notice the Minions actually have a
base of operations and are doing something in stages rather than an all out
launch. Remember, I didn't have Marauder attack the Maximal base, that was
deliberate on my part as I want to allow that plot line to happen.

Feel free to continue your plot, and I will do all I can to help it along as
well. My personal goal is not for the Minions (or any other faction for that
matter) to win ultimately, but to be sure that everyone has fun.

However, while I have your attention I did have some questions that perhaps
someone could help me with since I was not here during the original
inception of the RPG:

On the Wiki page there is written:

> Unicron was known to threaten the Past-Earth setting of NBW,
> but an alliance of factions were able to drive him away by
> creating a super-weapon. When Unicron left the system he left
> a force of his Minions behind. Unicron has yet to return but all
> assume that he eventually will.
AND THIS:

> After Unicron <https://mail.google.com/w/nbwrpg_wiki/unicron/> left the
periphery of the system, he left several
> sleeping Minions <https://mail.google.com/w/nbwrpg_wiki/minions/> on the
moon. He had realized that the
energon<https://mail.google.com/w/nbwrpg_wiki/energon/>
> present on Earth <https://mail.google.com/w/nbwrpg_wiki/earth/> was too
powerful for him to absorb right away,
> and had decided to keep a watchful eye on the planet until the
> crystals were ripe for his taking. With the Cybertronians<https://mail.google.com/w/nbwrpg_wiki/cybertronians/>out of
> his way, he went pleased with himself.

Both of these histories seem to be slightly different. In one he was driven
away by a super weapon and so left a force behind. In the other he left on
his own, and left a force to wait for better times. Any idea which is
correct? Also, what super weapon is being refered to, and is it still in
existance? Aand, how was the energon of old Earth too powerful for Unicron,
was it the Vok influence on things? I would imagine that the planet
destroyer Unicron would not be put off by the Earth, unless biological life
is difficult for him to absorb???

Also, is this Unicron from 4 millions years ago and so is ignorant of where
these BW's versions come from, or is this a Unicron that has been knocked
back 4 million years and so has knowledge of all the transformer events?

I know this is old news, and probrably not written by anyone here, but I am
making sure that it is still relevant to how we are playing now. If we need
to make any changes, now would probrably be a good time? This information
has an impact on how I plan to have the minions proceed and may modify the
goals the they have.

Any insights or thoughts that anyone has would be most appreciated.

Thanks
Preston
On Thu, Mar 25, 2010 at 2:40 AM, Kraftlos <kraftlos@...> wrote:

>
>
> OOC: It feels like things keep interrupting the Maximal plot.  They just
> arrived and most their stuff is in storage.  The base is in shambles and
> really not defensible at all.  I'm not saying you can't have a minion
> attack, but it really really help to have a period of time where the
> Maxmials can at least make that base their home and fortify a bit.
>
>
>

--000e0cd138f42c791e0482a29ca6
